00067 #include "resolv.h"
00068 #include "uip.h"
00069 
00070 #include <string.h>
00071 
00072 #ifndef NULL
00073 #define NULL (void *)0
00074 #endif /* NULL */
00075 
00077 #define MAX_RETRIES 8
00078 
00080 struct dns_hdr {
00081   u16_t id;
00082   u8_t flags1, flags2;
00083 #define DNS_FLAG1_RESPONSE        0x80
00084 #define DNS_FLAG1_OPCODE_STATUS   0x10
00085 #define DNS_FLAG1_OPCODE_INVERSE  0x08
00086 #define DNS_FLAG1_OPCODE_STANDARD 0x00
00087 #define DNS_FLAG1_AUTHORATIVE     0x04
00088 #define DNS_FLAG1_TRUNC           0x02
00089 #define DNS_FLAG1_RD              0x01
00090 #define DNS_FLAG2_RA              0x80
00091 #define DNS_FLAG2_ERR_MASK        0x0f
00092 #define DNS_FLAG2_ERR_NONE        0x00
00093 #define DNS_FLAG2_ERR_NAME        0x03
00094   u16_t numquestions;
00095   u16_t numanswers;
00096   u16_t numauthrr;
00097   u16_t numextrarr;
00098 };
00099 
00101 struct dns_answer {
00102   /* DNS answer record starts with either a domain name or a pointer
00103      to a name already present somewhere in the packet. */
00104   u16_t type;
00105   u16_t class;
00106   u16_t ttl[2];
00107   u16_t len;
00108   uip_ipaddr_t ipaddr;
00109 };
00110 
00111 struct namemap {
00112 #define STATE_UNUSED 0
00113 #define STATE_NEW    1
00114 #define STATE_ASKING 2
00115 #define STATE_DONE   3
00116 #define STATE_ERROR  4
00117   u8_t state;
00118   u8_t tmr;
00119   u8_t retries;
00120   u8_t seqno;
00121   u8_t err;
00122   char name[32];
00123   uip_ipaddr_t ipaddr;
00124 };
00125 
00126 #ifndef UIP_CONF_RESOLV_ENTRIES
00127 #define RESOLV_ENTRIES 4
00128 #else /* UIP_CONF_RESOLV_ENTRIES */
00129 #define RESOLV_ENTRIES UIP_CONF_RESOLV_ENTRIES
00130 #endif /* UIP_CONF_RESOLV_ENTRIES */
00131 
00132 
00133 static struct namemap names[RESOLV_ENTRIES];
00134 
00135 static u8_t seqno;
00136 
00137 static struct uip_udp_conn *resolv_conn = NULL;
00138 
00139 
00140 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 static unsigned char *
00148 parse_name(unsigned char *query)
00149 {
00150   unsigned char n;
00151 
00152   do {
00153     n = *query++;
00154 
00155     while(n > 0) {
00156       /*      printf("%c", *query);*/
00157       ++query;
00158       --n;
00159     };
00160     /*    printf(".");*/
00161   } while(*query != 0);
00162   /*  printf("\n");*/
00163   return query + 1;
00164 }
00165 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00170 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00171 static void
00172 check_entries(void)
00173 {
00174   register struct dns_hdr *hdr;
00175   char *query, *nptr, *nameptr;
00176   static u8_t i;
00177   static u8_t n;
00178   register struct namemap *namemapptr;
00179 
00180   for(i = 0; i < RESOLV_ENTRIES; ++i) {
00181     namemapptr = &names[i];
00182     if(namemapptr->state == STATE_NEW ||
00183        namemapptr->state == STATE_ASKING) {
00184       if(namemapptr->state == STATE_ASKING) {
00185         if(--namemapptr->tmr == 0) {
00186           if(++namemapptr->retries == MAX_RETRIES) {
00187             namemapptr->state = STATE_ERROR;
00188             resolv_found(namemapptr->name, NULL);
00189             continue;
00190           }
00191           namemapptr->tmr = namemapptr->retries;
00192         } else {
00193           /*      printf("Timer %d\n", namemapptr->tmr);*/
00194           /* Its timer has not run out, so we move on to next
00195              entry. */
00196           continue;
00197         }
00198       } else {
00199         namemapptr->state = STATE_ASKING;
00200         namemapptr->tmr = 1;
00201         namemapptr->retries = 0;
00202       }
00203       hdr = (struct dns_hdr *)uip_appdata;
00204       memset(hdr, 0, sizeof(struct dns_hdr));
00205       hdr->id = htons(i);
00206       hdr->flags1 = DNS_FLAG1_RD;
00207       hdr->numquestions = HTONS(1);
00208       query = (char *)uip_appdata + 12;
00209       nameptr = namemapptr->name;
00210       --nameptr;
00211       /* Convert hostname into suitable query format. */
00212       do {
00213         ++nameptr;
00214         nptr = query;
00215         ++query;
00216         for(n = 0; *nameptr != '.' && *nameptr != 0; ++nameptr) {
00217           *query = *nameptr;
00218           ++query;
00219           ++n;
00220         }
00221         *nptr = n;
00222       } while(*nameptr != 0);
00223       {
00224         static unsigned char endquery[] =
00225           {0,0,1,0,1};
00226         memcpy(query, endquery, 5);
00227       }
00228       uip_udp_send((unsigned char)(query + 5 - (char *)uip_appdata));
00229       break;
00230     }
00231   }
00232 }
00233 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00237 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00238 static void
00239 newdata(void)
00240 {
00241   char *nameptr;
00242   struct dns_answer *ans;
00243   struct dns_hdr *hdr;
00244   static u8_t nquestions, nanswers;
00245   static u8_t i;
00246   register struct namemap *namemapptr;
00247 
00248   hdr = (struct dns_hdr *)uip_appdata;
00249   /*  printf("ID %d\n", htons(hdr->id));
00250       printf("Query %d\n", hdr->flags1 & DNS_FLAG1_RESPONSE);
00251       printf("Error %d\n", hdr->flags2 & DNS_FLAG2_ERR_MASK);
00252       printf("Num questions %d, answers %d, authrr %d, extrarr %d\n",
00253       htons(hdr->numquestions),
00254       htons(hdr->numanswers),
00255       htons(hdr->numauthrr),
00256       htons(hdr->numextrarr));
00257   */
00258 
00259   /* The ID in the DNS header should be our entry into the name
00260      table. */
00261   i = htons(hdr->id);
00262   namemapptr = &names[i];
00263   if(i < RESOLV_ENTRIES &&
00264      namemapptr->state == STATE_ASKING) {
00265 
00266     /* This entry is now finished. */
00267     namemapptr->state = STATE_DONE;
00268     namemapptr->err = hdr->flags2 & DNS_FLAG2_ERR_MASK;
00269 
00270     /* Check for error. If so, call callback to inform. */
00271     if(namemapptr->err != 0) {
00272       namemapptr->state = STATE_ERROR;
00273       resolv_found(namemapptr->name, NULL);
00274       return;
00275     }
00276 
00277     /* We only care about the question(s) and the answers. The authrr
00278        and the extrarr are simply discarded. */
00279     nquestions = htons(hdr->numquestions);
00280     nanswers = htons(hdr->numanswers);
00281 
00282     /* Skip the name in the question. XXX: This should really be
00283        checked agains the name in the question, to be sure that they
00284        match. */
00285     nameptr = parse_name((char *)uip_appdata + 12) + 4;
00286 
00287     while(nanswers > 0) {
00288       /* The first byte in the answer resource record determines if it
00289          is a compressed record or a normal one. */
00290       if(*nameptr & 0xc0) {
00291         /* Compressed name. */
00292         nameptr +=2;
00293         /*      printf("Compressed anwser\n");*/
00294       } else {
00295         /* Not compressed name. */
00296         nameptr = parse_name((char *)nameptr);
00297       }
00298 
00299       ans = (struct dns_answer *)nameptr;
00300       /*      printf("Answer: type %x, class %x, ttl %x, length %x\n",
00301              htons(ans->type), htons(ans->class), (htons(ans->ttl[0])
00302              << 16) | htons(ans->ttl[1]), htons(ans->len));*/
00303 
00304       /* Check for IP address type and Internet class. Others are
00305          discarded. */
00306       if(ans->type == HTONS(1) &&
00307          ans->class == HTONS(1) &&
00308          ans->len == HTONS(4)) {
00309         /*      printf("IP address %d.%d.%d.%d\n",
00310                htons(ans->ipaddr[0]) >> 8,
00311                htons(ans->ipaddr[0]) & 0xff,
00312                htons(ans->ipaddr[1]) >> 8,
00313                htons(ans->ipaddr[1]) & 0xff);*/
00314         /* XXX: we should really check that this IP address is the one
00315            we want. */
00316         namemapptr->ipaddr[0] = ans->ipaddr[0];
00317         namemapptr->ipaddr[1] = ans->ipaddr[1];
00318 
00319         resolv_found(namemapptr->name, namemapptr->ipaddr);
00320         return;
00321       } else {
00322         nameptr = nameptr + 10 + htons(ans->len);
00323       }
00324       --nanswers;
00325     }
00326   }
00327 
00328 }
00329 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00333 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00334 void
00335 resolv_appcall(void)
00336 {
00337   if(uip_udp_conn->rport == HTONS(53)) {
00338     if(uip_poll()) {
00339       check_entries();
00340     }
00341     if(uip_newdata()) {
00342       newdata();
00343     }
00344   }
00345 }
00346 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00352 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00353 void
00354 resolv_query(char *name)
00355 {
00356   static u8_t i;
00357   static u8_t lseq, lseqi;
00358   register struct namemap *nameptr;
00359 
00360   lseq = lseqi = 0;
00361 
00362   for(i = 0; i < RESOLV_ENTRIES; ++i) {
00363     nameptr = &names[i];
00364     if(nameptr->state == STATE_UNUSED) {
00365       break;
00366     }
00367     if(seqno - nameptr->seqno > lseq) {
00368       lseq = seqno - nameptr->seqno;
00369       lseqi = i;
00370     }
00371   }
00372 
00373   if(i == RESOLV_ENTRIES) {
00374     i = lseqi;
00375     nameptr = &names[i];
00376   }
00377 
00378   /*  printf("Using entry %d\n", i);*/
00379 
00380   strcpy(nameptr->name, name);
00381   nameptr->state = STATE_NEW;
00382   nameptr->seqno = seqno;
00383   ++seqno;
00384 }
00385 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00398 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00399 u16_t *
00400 resolv_lookup(char *name)
00401 {
00402   static u8_t i;
00403   struct namemap *nameptr;
00404 
00405   /* Walk through the list to see if the name is in there. If it is
00406      not, we return NULL. */
00407   for(i = 0; i < RESOLV_ENTRIES; ++i) {
00408     nameptr = &names[i];
00409     if(nameptr->state == STATE_DONE &&
00410        strcmp(name, nameptr->name) == 0) {
00411       return nameptr->ipaddr;
00412     }
00413   }
00414   return NULL;
00415 }
00416 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00424 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00425 u16_t *
00426 resolv_getserver(void)
00427 {
00428   if(resolv_conn == NULL) {
00429     return NULL;
00430   }
00431   return resolv_conn->ripaddr;
00432 }
00433 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00440 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00441 void
00442 resolv_conf(u16_t *dnsserver)
00443 {
00444   if(resolv_conn != NULL) {
00445     uip_udp_remove(resolv_conn);
00446   }
00447 
00448   resolv_conn = uip_udp_new(dnsserver, HTONS(53));
00449 }
00450 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00454 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00455 void
00456 resolv_init(void)
00457 {
00458   static u8_t i;
00459 
00460   for(i = 0; i < RESOLV_ENTRIES; ++i) {
00461     names[i].state = STATE_DONE;
00462   }
00463 
00464 }
